docs.lead_paragraph: The publisher of an influential newspaper in the early voting state of New Hampshire said on Sunday the paper had endorsed Republican Chris Christie in the U.S. presidential contest because of his experience and potential to take on rival Donald Trump.
docs.snippet: The publisher of an influential newspaper in the early voting state of New Hampshire said on Sunday the paper had endorsed Republican Chris Christie in the U.S. presidential contest because of his experience and potential to take on rival Donald T...

headline.print_headline: Republican Christie, Seen as Alternative to Trump, Wins Coveted Endorsement
headline.main: Republican Christie, Seen as Alternative to Trump, Wins Coveted Endorsement

docs.lead_paragraph: ZELNICK--Stacy Alexandra, 45, of Clinton Corners, passed away suddenly in an accident which occurred on Tuesday, November 24th, 2015 at her home. Born on August 19, 1970, in Hollywood, FL, she was the daughter of Irene (Levitt) Zelnick and Stephen Zelnick of New York City and Clinton Corners, NY. In addition to her mother and father, she is survived by a daughter; Jade Walker of Millbrook, NY and an uncle, Edward Zelnick, MD, of Hollywood, FL. Raised in New York City, Stacy was a graduate of St. Ann's School in Brooklyn, NY and attended Bard College in Annandale on Hudson, NY. She was beautiful, graceful, athletic, artistic, musical, an outstanding writer of fiction and poetry and very smart. She was vivacious and had a great sense of humor and was quick to laugh. She was great company and was always there for her friends. Her presence could light up a room. Stacy was also an avid horse lover and an amazing and accomplished equestrian. She was manager and head horse trainer of Willowbrook Riding Stables in Clinton Corners. Stacy will be sorely missed, especially by her daughter to whom she was devoted and by her parents who were devoted to her. Services were held Saturday, November 28th, 2015. Interment was held at Rhinebeck Cemetery, Rhinebeck, NY. Services are under the direction of Burnett & White Funeral Homes 7461 S. Broadway, Red Hook, NY. For directions, or to sign the online guest book, please visit www.Burnett-White.com. 1/3

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Dear lived in a white trailer on a patch of land by the Rocky Mountains and was described as “a mountain culture person.”

byline.contributor: Julie Turkewitz reported from Hartsel, Richard Fausset from Goose Creek, S.C., Alan Blinder from Black Mountain, N.C., and Benjamin Mueller from New York. Jack Healy, Dave Philipps and Kassondra Cloos contributed reporting from Colorado Springs; Michael S. Schmidt from Washington; and Ashley Southall, Liam Stack, Mike McIntire and Jack Begg from New York.
byline.original: By JULIE TURKEWITZ, RICHARD FAUSSET, ALAN BLINDER and BENJAMIN MUELLER

docs.abstract: Investigation into Robert L Dear Jr, suspect who carried out shooting at Colorado Springs Planned Parenthood clinic, reveals itinerant loner with history of conflicts with law, neighbors and family; some acquaintances describe episodes of violence by Dear or feeling fearful of him.

headline.main: Robert Dear, Suspect in Colorado Killings, ‘Preferred to Be Left Alone’

docs.lead_paragraph: Climate change has become a hallmark for President Obama’s second term, and potentially a signature achievement.
docs.snippet: Climate change has become a hallmark for President Obama’s second term, and potentially a signature achievement....
docs.abstract: Pres Obama aims to make addressing global warming key aspect of his legacy ahead of Paris meeting of world leaders on environment; experts cite unprecedented presidential focus and potential for progress on issue; president and handpicked team who devoted second term to climate change policy now face vigorous Republican opposition.

headline.print_headline: Obama’s Climate Push Is Shaping Contours of His Coming Legacy
headline.main: Obama’s Legacy at Stake in Paris Talks on Climate Accord

docs.lead_paragraph: Age, or the conspicuous lack of it, is something that infuses almost every element of the Rubio campaign.
docs.snippet: Age, or the conspicuous lack of it, is something that infuses almost every element of the Rubio campaign....
docs.abstract: Presidential campaign of Marco Rubio has been emphasizing his relative youth in attempt to reverse dynamic that has typically associated Democrats with change and youth and Republicans with older politicians and ideas; Rubio must, nonetheless, appeal to base of party that has become increasingly older and whiter.

headline.print_headline: In Grand Old (and Getting Older) Party, Rubio Bets on Appeal of His Younger Face
headline.main: Marco Rubio Bets the Grand Old Party Is Ready for His Younger Face

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama responded angrily Saturday to the mass shooting in Colorado Springs that took three lives, calling the country’s recurring outbreak of gun violence “not normal.”
docs.snippet: President Obama responded angrily Saturday to the mass shooting in Colorado Springs that took three lives, calling the country’s recurring outbreak of gun violence “not normal.”...
docs.abstract: Pres Obama responds angrily to mass shooting at Colorado Springs, Colo, Planned Parenthood clinic, calling it unacceptable and condemning recent deaths from gun violence across nation; 2016 presidential candidates also release statements, with Republicans noticeably hesitant to offer support for clinic or address issue of gun control.

headline.print_headline: ‘Enough Is Enough,’ Obama Says After the Latest Outbreak of Gun Violence
headline.main: Obama Says ‘Enough Is Enough’ After Colorado Shooting

docs.lead_paragraph: On death by Internet and the linguistic arms race to out-hyperbole each other with phrases like “Omg literally dying,” “I can’t even” and “yassssss.”
docs.snippet: On death by Internet and the linguistic arms race to out-hyperbole each other with phrases like “Omg literally dying,” “I can’t even” and “yassssss.”...
docs.abstract: Social media users tend to be overly dramatic when expressing emotion, bringing truncated hyperbole to English language that borders on the frequently absurd.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some leading Republican presidential candidates seem to view Muslims as fair game for increasingly harsh words they might use with more caution against any other group for fear of the political cost. So far, that strategy is winning support from conservatives influential in picking the nominee.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama is trying to negotiate a legacy-making climate change pact this coming week in Paris with one hand tied behind his back. Congress can't even agree whether global warming is real.
